result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Parez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber, all standard release conditions. If imposed, 25 days credit granted, and to be served concurrent to any other sentence. STAYED for probation.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is to be paid, as a condition of probation, before any other costs or fees. Restitution breakdown is as follows:
- $573.17 for Victim A on case 22CF153
- $3,183.46 for Victim A on 22CM155
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Comply with DTC contract.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: With Huber, all standard release conditions. If imposed, 25 days credit granted, and to be served concurrent to any other sentence. STAYED for probation.
Conditions of probation on Count 2 are the same as conditions on Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:44 AM Defendant Christopher J Parez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
State files an amended information. 
Defense accepts filing of the amended information, waive reading and enters not guilty pleas. 

Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 2. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1 and 2. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22CF263, 22CF322 and 22CM118. 

Court orders the following:
Count 1.
6 Months in Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
concurrent to any other sentence
25 Days credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION
Term of Probation: 18 months
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Comply with DTC contract
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $573.17 owed to Victim A on case 22CF153 and $3183.46 owed to Victim A on case 22CM155 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Count 2
6 Months in Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
concurrent to any other sentence
25 Days credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION
Term of Probation: 18 months
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Comply with DTC contract
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Motion and order to seal victim impact statement
filed by the State under seal.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered and Amended Information

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Wang indicates Attorney Ricardo Tapia will be appointed to represent the defendant.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.
